After graduating from high school, she began her career in the entertainment industry as a personal assistant to a prominent talent agent.

Kris's big break came when she married Robert Kardashian, a successful lawyer and member of the Kardashian family, in 1978. The couple had four children together: Kourtney, Kim, Khloé, and Rob. In 2007, Kris brought her family into the spotlight with the reality TV show "Keeping Up with the Kardashians," which quickly became a ratings juggernaut. The show's success propelled Kris to celebrity status, and she became known for her sharp business acumen, fierce maternal instincts, and unapologetic candor.

Today, Kris is the CEO of Kris Jenner Productions, a company that produces multiple reality TV shows, including "Keeping Up with the Kardashians" and "Life of Kylie." She is also a bestselling author, with her memoir "In the Kitchen with Kris" debuting at number one on the New York Times bestseller list. Kris has won numerous awards for her work, including multiple Emmy nominations, and has been recognized as one of the most powerful women in Hollywood. Despite her many accomplishments, Kris remains fiercely dedicated to her family and continues to balance her career with her role as a loving mother and grandmother.
